question_text: Which TWO of the following actions help prevent airflow issues when using a fixed-cable power supply in a compact case? (Select two)
answer_options: Routing unused cables behind the motherboard tray
Leaving unused cables bunched near the CPU fan
Switching to a hybrid supply with modular GPU connectors
Using a dual-fan PSU for cooling
correct_answer: Routing unused cables behind the motherboard tray
Switching to a hybrid supply with modular GPU connectors
explanation: Fixed cables can restrict airflow if unmanaged. Routing behind the tray and using hybrid supplies can mitigate clutter and overheating.
